titleStmt.title: The order and manner of the sitting of the Lords spirituall and temporall as peeres of the realme, in the higher house of Parliament, according to their dignities, offices, and degrees, some other called thither for their assistance, and officers of their attendances. And also the names of the knights for the counties, citizens, burgesses for the boroughs, and barons for the ports for the House of Commons, for this Parliament.
Lists. 1628-03-17
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by A. Mathewes] for Thomas Walkly, and are to be solde at the signe of the Eagle and Childe at the new Exchange,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
